pages.title: The Magical Bestiary
pages.text: A compendium of fairy creatures and their notable traits.$(br2)Each section includes a blurb about the creature and whether it can be tamed or befriended and if so by what foods/items.$(br2)Most entries also include a captioned picture so that intrepid survivalists will be able to recognize them in-person.$(br)
Many fairy creatures like odd or unusual things - including gold or glowing mushrooms.  Come prepared with some shiny odds and ends$(br2)What mysteries await?

pages.title: Starbunkle
pages.text: These peaceful fairy creatures appear in forested regions and love shiny things.$(br2)They are very skittish and will run from humans if they see them$(br2)They love gold nuggets and will permit someone to approach them who is holding one.  If offered a Gold Nugget they may give you something in return.$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.A: An Adult Starbuncle
pages.text: Where do they come from?  No one knows$(br2)

pages.title: Stoneling
pages.text: Mysterious earth fairies that can only be found underground (usually in complete darkness).  They will run from humans and loud noises.$(br2)A sneaky explorer holding a Glow Mushroom may be able to tempt a Stoneling into arms reach long enough to shatter its stone form$(br2)The resulting Heart of Stone can be used on a Stone Block to reincorporate the grateful Fairy - effectively taming it.$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.B: A Stoneling
pages.text: A tamed Stoneline will hold items for you, eat Stone from your hand or even follow you (if you have a Glow Mushroom)$(br2)

pages.title: Whirlisprig
pages.text: These peaceful and curious nature fairies appear in forested regions.$(br2)Those who witness someone caring for nature (by growing trees) will reward that person with nature magic...seeing them as a kindred spirit.$(br2)

pages.name: Fig.C: A Whirlisprig
pages.text: Whirlisprigs will follow creatures they are curious to know more about.$(br2)
